result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with New Berlin West.

To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher R Foley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Employer and Probation Agent, received and filed in court.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher R Foley in court with attorney Joseph G Alioto.   
Court to Review the Deferred Judgment under 961.47.

Defendant has successfully completed the Deferred Judgment under 961.47.
Therefore, State moves to Vacate the Plea and Dismiss this Matter.
Defense has no objections.
Court Grants - Plea entered is vacated and matter is dismissed.

Terminated - Deferred Probation
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status
Discharge date:  06-15-2016
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Review hearing at 06-22-2016 09:00 am

Packet of Treatment, Character and Employment Letters, received and filed in court by Atty. Alioto.

To be Sealed per Judge Lee S. Dreyfus.
with Jury Instructions

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher R Foley in court with attorney Joseph G Alioto.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2 but withholds entry of judgment.
Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.

Defense is requesting Conditional Discharge under 961.47 and presented arguments.
State takes no position.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.

Court Adopts the provisions of 961.47 and withholds entry of judgment.
Court withholds entry of Judgment until the next court date.  If defendant successfully completes probation, court will vacate the plea and dismiss the matter.



Court orders the following:
WITHHELD SENTENCE;

Term of Probation: 9 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
No contact with:  New Berlin West.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


  Review hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
